page.title: 07The Ayrshire Post.
page.content: The Post has been Ayr's local {newspaper}for 106 years. With a readership of 120000 it is Scotland's largest provincial paper and is part of a large national group of papers. This however has no bearing on editorial freedom and the paper will print any story of local interest. The most important issue carried this year concerns the M.O.D's plans to build a signals installation in the {Galloway Hills.} The complex will cover many square miles and will deprive S.W. Scotland one of our last areas of{outstanding natural beauty. The Post is campaigning to halt the project. A local journalist feels more responsibility to his readership than a reporter with a national paper. The Post's circulation is rising steadily _ a healthy sign for the future of our most popular local paper
